security: Revealing the NSA's signals intelligence activities, specifically monitoring diplomatic communications, could compromise their operational methods and sources. Disclosing that the NSA intercepted and processed a message about funding a journalist in Dallas on the day of the assassination reveals sensitive intelligence collection capabilities and targets. Quoting directly: 'REPRESENTATIVE OF ARBEITER-ZEITUNG TO BE IN DALLAS...Please have the honorary consulate in Dallas put $2ØØ at the disposal of editor FIELHAUER of the Arbeiter-Zeitung.'
summary: An NSA report details an intercepted message from the Austrian Foreign Ministry to its embassy in Washington, requesting that the honorary consulate in Dallas provide $200 to editor FIELHAUER of the Arbeiter-Zeitung, who is expected to report in Dallas on November 23, 1963.
summary_one_paragraph: This TOP SECRET UMBRA report, dated November 26, 1963, originates from the NSA and is addressed to HCO [R]. It concerns intercepted communications (3/0/W/T1596-63) indicating that the Austrian Foreign Ministry instructed its embassy in Washington to arrange for the honorary consulate in Dallas to provide $200 to editor FIELHAUER of the Arbeiter-Zeitung. Fielhauer was expected to report in Dallas around November 23, 1963. The report includes a reference to Austrian diplomatic activity, and notes that the information is compartmented and requires originating agency determination for release.
title: 3/0/W/T1596-63: REPRESENTATIVE OF ARBITER-ZEITUNG TO BE IN DALLAS [R]
